title: warning: comparison of constant 0 with expression of type 'bool' is always false
body_html:
When I build 6dc1fc7 on OS X clang I get this warning:

  if (THPUtils_parseSlice(slice, length, &start, &stop, &step, &slicelength) < 0) {
      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ^ ~

I would fix it but I don't know what the intended semantics are.

CC @colesbury as very cursory blaming suggests you wrote this code
body_text:

CC @colesbury as very cursory blaming suggests you wrote this code
body:
When I build 6dc1fc7e6951aca4365926b3b487b7666efe2688 on OS X clang I get this warning:

```
  if (THPUtils_parseSlice(slice, length, &start, &stop, &step, &slicelength) < 0) {
      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ^ ~
```

I would fix it but I don't know what the intended semantics are.

CC @colesbury as very cursory blaming suggests you wrote this code
